about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?

about.name: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?

hasPart.assesses: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving? | When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal for minors to use a cell phone at all while driving, except to contact an emergency entity in an emergency situation. For adult drivers, the use of hands-free devices is permitted; however, to avoid distractions, it is advisable to make calls only if needed to call for help in an emergency.

suggestedAnswer.text: When making a call while stopped at the red light

comment.text: When making a call while stopped at the red light

suggestedAnswer.text: When making a call for emergency assistance

comment.text: When making a call for emergency assistance
Never

acceptedAnswer.text: When making a call for emergency assistance

comment.text: When making a call for emergency assistance

answerExplanation.text: It is illegal for minors to use a cell phone at all while driving, except to contact an emergency entity in an emergency situation. For adult drivers, the use of hands-free devices is permitted; however, to avoid distractions, it is advisable to make calls only if needed to call for help in an emergency.

comment.text: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving? | It is illegal for minors to use a cell phone at all while driving, except to contact an emergency entity in an emergency situation. For adult drivers, the use of hands-free devices is permitted; however, to avoid distractions, it is advisable to make calls only if needed to call for help in an emergency.

hasPart.assesses: This red and white sign means you should: | This red and white sign means you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.

comment.text: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.

suggestedAnswer.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

comment.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

suggestedAnswer.text: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.

comment.text: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.

acceptedAnswer.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

comment.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

answerExplanation.text: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

hasPart.name: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely:

about.name: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely:

hasPart.assesses: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely: | You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver travels more quickly or more slowly than the other vehicles on the road. You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

comment.text: 25 mph.
35 mph.
30 mph.
35 mph.

answerExplanation.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver travels more quickly or more slowly than the other vehicles on the road. You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

comment.text: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely: | Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver travels more quickly or more slowly than the other vehicles on the road. You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.
